main event: One round bright white light the size of a dime was seen descending in the west for 1 hour and 15 minutes at Bellefontaine AFB, Ohio in 1957.
interesting points: The observation lasted for a significant amount of time, indicating a prolonged sighting of the object.
The object was described as a bright white light the size of a dime, suggesting a small and intensely luminous appearance.
The conclusion of the report indicated that the sighting was likely Venus, attributing the event to an astronomical phenomenon.
There were no photographs of the sighting, indicating a lack of visual documentation for the event.
The report dismissed alternative explanations such as weather phenomena, aircraft, and astronautical or other atmospheric sources.
